trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_SEQ_00<tab>Linuhanu wishes to take you to the shipwright.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Linuhanu.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Wuk Evu.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Linuhanu.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Krile.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Linuhanu.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_TODO_05<tab>Search Cave Kikitola and obtain raw abokixa.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_TODO_06<tab>Show the raw abokixa to Linuhanu.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_TODO_07<tab>Deliver the raw abokixa to Wuk Evu.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_TODO_08<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_000_001<tab>We're making progress now! The solution to Ok'hanu's woes is as good as found!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_005<tab>I wonder what manner of shipwright repairs reed-woven boats...

TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_010<tab>The shipwright's name is Wuk Evu. He's a Xbr'aal who only moved to Kozama'uka a few years ago, but has since mastered our customs to an almost frightening degree.

TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_011<tab>He's especially strict when it comes to manners, so make sure to offer him a proper Hanuhanu greeting. We wouldn't want to offend him right before asking a favor.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_000_012<tab>A proper Hanuhanu greeting...? Oh, <var 1A 02 /var>that<var 1A 01 /var> one!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_000_013<tab>Don't worry, I remember how it goes!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_014<tab>Then we shouldn't have any problems. Let's head to Ok'bek'be, to the east of here.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_100_020<tab>Look over there! Do you see that big, winding staircase!?
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_100_021<tab>Oh, it seems they have a place here where visitors can stay. Looks cozy.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_200_022<tab>This is Ok'bek'be, the Village of All. Those who drift into Kozama'uka from Tuliyollal and elsewhere are welcome to live here alongside the Hanu.

TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_300_023<tab>As for Wuk Evu, he lives and works in the House of Waters High, at the top of that large tree nearby. Follow me, but I should warn you: the climb up the stairs can be challenging.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_000_020<tab>O-ho-ka-liy... Ohokaliy...
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_025<tab>I should mention that Wuk Evu isn't only a stickler for etiquette. He is also... Well, you'll find out soon enough.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_030<tab>We <var 1A 02 /var>are<var 1A 01 /var> hoping to enlist the man's aid, so it pays not to be rude in any case.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_040<tab>A rather eccentric fellow, but I feel his heart is in the right place!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_045<tab>Cave Kikitola is southwest of Ok'hanu. We can return to the village first, then head there on foot.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_050<tab>I almost envy how effortlessly he can shift from one mood to its polar opposite. At least I presume he does so by choice...
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_055<tab>Southwest of here, was it? Let us be on our way.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_060<tab>Look, you can see the falls at the back of the cave! These hollows must have been carved out by the constant deluge of water from above...
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_065<tab>Cave Kikitola, as promised. Home to many deadly creatures. Venture inside if you feel confident, but I will conduct my own search out here.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_066<tab>You can spot raw abokixa by its green-hued glimmer. Bring anything matching that description to me.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_067<tab>I shall help scour the inside of the cave, then. You take the west half and I'll take the east!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_070<tab>I am reluctant to send you into danger for the sake of the float, but if you are willing...
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_SYSTEM_000_075<tab>Upon closer inspection, you find that the glimmer you spied was just light reflecting off the water...
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_SYSTEM_000_076<tab>A shiny pebble catches your eye, but its coloring is grey rather than green.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_SYSTEM_000_077<tab>You find a chunk of stone glowing a distinct shade of green. This seems like the exact kind of mineral Linuhanu was looking for.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_080<tab>Some of the cave's inhabitants took umbrage at my presence, but it was nothing a few swishes of my brush couldn't handle.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_085<tab>I picked over the ground near the entrance but found nothing. Did you have better luck inside the cave?
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_086<tab>Yes, this is abokixa. Along with Krile's contribution, we have more than enough for our needs.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_087<tab>The stones you've brought shine very brightly. I thank you both.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_100_088<tab>...He would have been happy to know we were putting things right.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_088<tab>Truth be told, a good friend of mine was meant to be festival leader for this year's Ihih'hana.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_089<tab>But when that big storm hit, he...he did not survive. It fell to me to carry on in his stead.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_090<tab>That was why you agreed to Wuk Lamat's request, despite your initial reluctance.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_091<tab>Yes. It hurt to hear, but she was right. Though I must mourn, I cannot let my grief consume me.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_092<tab>Her words made me realize that the path to my recovery─our recovery─is already laid out before me. And I will walk it. For myself, and for my friend.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_093<tab>Thank you for sharing your story with us. Please, rest assured that we've taken your plight to heart.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_094<tab>I'm certain our companions are procuring the other materials as we speak.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_095<tab>Everything will come together, and the Hanu shall host a splendid, uplifting festival!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_096<tab>That we shall!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_097<tab>With that, let us return and deliver the abokixa into Wuk Evu's waiting hands.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_000_100<tab>We just got back ourselves. Did you find the stone we needed?
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_105<tab>I hope Wuk Lamat's foray was as productive as ours.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_110<tab>We've come too far to stop now. The Lifting of Wings must go on!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKEVU_000_115<tab>Thanks to the Third Promise and her mighty swings, we've collected some suitable logs of uyuipo. What of the abokixa?
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKEVU_000_116<tab>Yes, these are excellent samples. A goodly quantity, too.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKEVU_000_117<tab>At this stage, you've likely surmised that the Lifting of Wings encourages the crops to grow─but not exactly <var 1A 02 /var>how<var 1A 01 /var>, eh?
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKEVU_000_118<tab>Well, you're in for a treat. If all goes to plan, the results should be <var 1A 02 /var>spectacular<var 1A 01 /var>.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKEVU_000_119<tab>Now, to get to work crafting these pieces for the float. I could use an assistant versed in the arcane arts to enhance the uyuipo's conductivity...
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_100_121<tab>Then I'd be delighted to help.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_121<tab>Everyone else should head back to Ok'hanu. We'll join you at the float once the work here is complete.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_KRILE_000_130<tab>I'm excited to see how Ihih'hana turns out!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKEVU_000_135<tab>The final touches are fairly routine and shouldn't take long. Go ahead and wait by the float.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_LINUHANU_000_140<tab>As Wuk Evu said, the festival really is a spectacle to behold.
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_000_145<tab>Gathering the uyuipo was a trial in and of itself.

TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_000_146<tab>At first, Wuk Evu criticized everything I did. Then he suddenly yelled “I've spoken ill of the Third Promise and must punish myself!” and proceeded to slam his head into an uyuipo tree...
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_000_147<tab>I told him not to worry about it─again─and it was like snuffing out a candle. He's an odd one, that's for sure!
TEXT_KINGMA109_04868_WUKLAMAT_000_148<tab>At least we've seen to the poles and the new eye. Now we just have to wait for the feathers from the twins!
